explanation: Agent A is correct. The expression in 'if (1)' is an invariant (always true) and is not being used to form an infinite loop nor is it a do-while false constant exception, so it violates MISRA C:2023 Rule 14.3. The surrounding conditional compilation (#ifdef _WIN32) does not remove the invariant when _WIN32 is defined, so the controlling expression remains invariant in that configuration. The construct appears to be used simply to introduce a scope; a plain block '{ ... }' or removal of the if would avoid the MISRA violation.
